title: SEC Launches Crypto Task Force with Significant Staffing Changes
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) restructured its cryptocurrency regulatory approach by dissolving its previous Crypto Asset and Cyber Unit and launching a new Cyber and Emerging Technologies Unit, signaling a shift from enforcement to regulatory framework development.
description: The SEC began a significant restructuring of its cryptocurrency regulatory team, reducing the staff size from 50 to 30 and reorienting the unit's focus from enforcement to creating a comprehensive regulatory framework for digital assets.

sources.title: SEC's New Crypto 2.0 Task Force Gets to Work
SEC's Newly Established Crypto Task Force: An Ambitious Agenda to Fill in the Gaps

notes: Significant restructuring of SEC's cryptocurrency regulatory approach, moving from enforcement to framework development.
additional_context: Part of broader 2025 shift in U.S. digital asset regulation, focusing on creating clear guidelines rather than punitive enforcement.
